content.webTitle: Open thread: Will it snow this Christmas?

fields.headline: Whither the weather?
fields.bodyText: According to the Darlington and Stockton Times, if the colony of stoats at Mount Grace Priory in Yorkshire turn white early – a form of camouflage that makes it harder for predators to spot them in snow – the winter will be harsher than usual. (A white stoat is properly known as an ermine.) But despite the colder-than-usual temperatures, the BBC is predicting no snow and only a hard frost Christmas Day and the Met Office freezing fog. So much for the experts: with C-Day less than a week away, what's your prediction?
